main event: A round object the size of a medium star was observed in Fairbanks, Alaska in December 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed in straight line motion for 20-35 seconds, The first observer, a weather forecaster with 14 years of experience, stated the object was a meteor, The second observation lasted for 2 seconds with a reddish orange change noted, The sighting was considered insufficient data for evaluation, Multiple witnesses associated with air traffic control were involved in the observation.
sighted object: one round object, size of medium star
witness description: A weather forecaster and a tower operator
